Reason: The 'concurrent_materialized_view_writes' configuration is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the performance of materialized views in the system. The developer's explanation indicates that this configuration manages updates, provides locks, and affects changes on the view, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. Additionally, the triggering frequency of this configuration is dependent on the number of concurrent reads or writes, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level. Proper management of concurrent reads and writes is crucial for optimal performance, highlighting the significance of this configuration in impacting system performance.
